ALLEGATION: It is alleged that a “Safety Plan” in place is not providing
safety to Youth A after he was attacked by other peers in the facility.
INVESTIGATION:
I spoke to Administrator 1 on 1/19/22. Allegations were discussed as well as
documentation that is needed. Administrator 1 reported that Youth A is refusing some
aspects of the “safety plan”; therefore, placing himself in unsafe situations. Youth A did
refuse to move to another building right after the attack incident. Staff at the facility
asked him to go to another building while they worked this out and he refused.
Administrator 1 reported Youth A was placed at the facility on 1/6/22. Since then, he has
been in two altercations with different youth, AWOLed, and has attempted to self-harm.
Administrator 1 reported they have put in a “safety plan” and 15 Minute Observations to
keep him safe. Administrator 1 reported that Youth A has not been compliant with all
aspects of the safety plan and has verbalized he doesn’t feel safe but has not provided
any detail to why he doesn’t feel safe. Administrator 1 reported he has not been given
any information alleging that Youth A has been bullied or threatened by the peers who
attacked him.
2

I reviewed the following documents throughout the course of the investigation:
 Safety Plan
 Face Sheet
 Incident reports
 15 Minute Observation Sheets
I reviewed the Incident Report dated 1/9/22. The incident occurred at 8:45pm. Youth A
was eating in the dining area of the dorm when three youth ran at him and attacked him.
Staff that were present and additional staff were called into the dorm to break up the
fight. Youth A was assessed for injuries and had swelling on his left and right cheek
areas. Youth A refused medical attention. Police were contacted and Youth A was
removed to the other dorm for the night. Youth A w as seen on 1/10/22 by Clinical
Director to ensure there were no injuries. Youth A reported that he was not injured.
I reviewed the “safety plan” on 1/19/22. The safety plan outlines Youth A to remain near
staff and to move around with the staff while in the unit. Youth A’s bed has been moved
to be closer to staff. Midnight staff will position themselves closer to Youth A’s bed and
any bullying or verbal threats will be immediately reported to the therapist and program
supervisor. The “safety plan” was created on 1/11/22.
**It is to be noted that Youth A has refused to sign the safety plan. This is noted on the
safety plan dated 1/11/22.
I reviewed the Incident Report dated 1/12/22. Youth A AWOLed from the facility and
was returned by the police. Youth A did not have any injuries.
I reviewed the 15 Minute Observation Sheets that were completed on 1/10/22-present
day (1/19/22). Staff documented Youth A’s whereabouts and actions every 15 minutes.
I reviewed the Incident Report dated 1/16/22. Youth A attempted to hurt himself by
wrapping his robe around his neck and around his rack area on his bed. Staff were
present and took the clothing item from Youth A. Staff called 911 and notified supervisor
immediately. A follow up meeting with Youth A and the site supervisor occurred on
1/17/22. 15-minute watches were to continue. A follow up meeting with Clinical Director
and Youth A occurred on 1/17/22 and the same outcome occurred.
I reviewed the Medical Appointment/Urgent Care Form. Youth A was seen by the
McClaren Oakland on 1/16/22 at 10:15pm. Follow up was to occur with counselor and
monitoring for behavior changes.
I reviewed the Incident Report dated 1/17/22. Youth A was in an altercation with another
peer over a t-shirt at 6:30pm. Youth A refused accountability and refused his safety
plan, going to another building for the night. At 8:40pm that night, that same peer
3

attacked Youth A and they were in another altercation. Youth A continued to refuse his
“safety plan”. Youth A would not go to the other building for the evening.
All interviews were conducted face to face at the facility on 1/21/22.
The dorm area is separated by two doors. There is a bed area and then a “front” area
with the kitchen and living area. Youth A was in the kitchen area eating a snack. The
other three peers were in the bed area.
I interviewed Youth A. Youth A reported that the youths pushed past a female staff and
attacked him. Youth A reported there were four staff in the dorm at the time of the
incident. Youth A reported there were two staff in the “front area” with him and other
peers. There were two staff at each door that was separating the front and back areas.
The three-youths pushed past the staff at the door and started to attack him. Youth A
reported that two more staff were called into the dorm to help. Youth A reported he felt
that staff sat back and watched him get hurt. Youth A did report three staff did help
remove the other peers off him though. Youth A reported that after this incident those
three peers have stated disrespectful comments to him. Youth A reported they have not
threatened him. Youth A reported he does not believe that the safety plan will keep him
safe because he feels that he already must be in the line of sight of staff. Youth A
reported he was unsure what staff could do to keep him safe. Youth A reported there
are always two staff on shift. Youth A reported that due to his truancy, he must remove
his outside clothes when in the door and put his shoes up. Youth A reported he truanted
because he felt unsafe. Youth A reported he said he was going to hurt himself because
he was frustrated with no one helping him.
I interviewed Therapist 1. Therapist 1 reported she usually sees the youth once a week
but has seen Youth A more than once per week due to the current issues. Therapist 1
reported she completed the “safety plan” with Youth A and he refused to sign it.
Therapist 1 reported Youth A understands the plan but just felt it wasn’t going to work
so didn’t sign it. Therapist 1 reported that Youth A was asked to go to another unit for a
night and he refused to do so. Therapist 1 reported she has provided this information to
Youth A’s mother as well. Therapist 1 reported all the youth in the incident have been
addressed. Therapist 1 reported the three other youth involved have accepted
responsibility and have done well over the last week. Youth A has not moved on from
this incident, but is still being involved in other incidents, including AWOL, self-harm,
and physical altercation. Therapist 1 reported that she has seen Youth A playing Uno
with one of the peers who attacked him. Therapist 1 reported she has not been given
any information that the three youth are bullying or threatening Youth A in any way
since the attack. Therapist 1 reported Youth A stated he ran away because he was
frustrated with other peers taking too long marching outside; therefore, the unit had to
wait for those peers to catch up in line. Therapist 1 reported that Youth A reported to
her that he tried to hurt himself because he doesn’t get enough phone calls.
I interviewed Staff 1. Staff 1 reported there is a “safety plan” in place for Youth A. Staff1
knew the safety plan. Staff 1 reported there was one “passive aggressive” comment
4

made by one of the three youth after the incident and this was redirected. Staff 1
reported he has not heard any comments since then. Staff 1 reported Youth A has not
told him about any threats. Staff 1 reported the unit is usually broken into two units.
Youth A is not with the other three youth.
I interviewed Supervisor 1. Supervisor 1 reported she was involved in the incident on
1/9/22. Supervisor 1 reported that units were divided and the three youth in the
bedroom were trying to get up front to Youth A. There were two staff stationed at the
doors and one of the youths did push past one of the staff in the doorway to attack
Youth A. Supervisor1 reported there were three staff in the unit and two more came in
after they called for assistance. Supervisor 1 reported that two of the staff removed the
youths from Youth A and a peer grabbed another youth without being asked to help.
Supervisor 1 reported Youth A stated he had no injuries, although his cheeks were red.
Supervisor 1 reported they called the police and Youth A refused to press charges.
Supervisor 1 reported neither staff or Youth A has not told her that anyone has
threatened or bullied him since the incident. Supervisor 1 reported there is a “safety
plan” in place and Youth A does not always follow it. Youth A has refused to go to the
other unit for safety and to stay arm’s length with staff. Supervisor 1 reported they even
called Youth A’s mother to attempt to have him listen to her, but that did not work.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4157 Behavior management.
(1) An institution shall establish and follow written policies
and
procedures that describe the institution’s behavior
management system. The policies and procedures shall be
reviewed annually and updated as needed. These shall be
available to all residents, their families, and referring
agencies.
ANALYSIS: The facility put a safety plan into place after the incident on
1/9/22. Staff and supervision are aware of the safety plan and
are documenting 15-minute observations. Therapist 1 has seen
Youth A on more occasions than the once per week session to
provide support to Youth A. Youth A has refused parts of the
safety plan, but the agency has done their due diligence in
creating an environment where Youth A can be safe.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
It is recommended the license remain unchanged.
